qas.question: What is Hanover a German capital for?
What is the name of the largest Marksmen's Fun Fair in the world?
How many rides and inns does the fair have?
How many participants are int he Parade of the Marksmen?
What year can the festival be traced back to?
What is the most important exhibition city in the world?
What is the name of the smallest marksman's fun fair in the world?
How many of your tents make up the highlight of the marksman's fair
How many people watch the parade of the marksman?
Where can you find the biggest fixed Ferris wheel in the world?

context: But <b5_0>Hanover<b5_0/> is not only one of the most important Exhibition Cities in the world, it is also one of the German capitals for <a0_0>marksmen<a0_0/>. The <a1_0>Schützenfest Hannover<a1_0/> is the largest <b6_0>Marksmen's Fun Fair<b6_0/> in the world and takes place once a year (late June to early July) (2014 - July 4th to the 13th). It consists of <a2_0>more than 260<a2_0/> rides and inns, <b7_0>five<b7_0/> large beer tents and a big entertainment programme. The highlight of this fun fair is the 12 kilometres (7 mi) long Parade of the Marksmen with more than <a3_0><b8_0>12.000<b8_0/><a3_0/> participants from all over the world, among them around 5.000 marksmen, 128 bands and more than 70 wagons, carriages and big festival vehicles. It is the longest procession in Europe. Around 2 million people visit this fun fair every year. The landmark of this <b9_0>Fun Fair<b9_0/> is the biggest transportable Ferris Wheel in the world (60 m or 197 ft high). The origins of this fun fair is located in the year <a4_0>1529<a4_0/>.
